import { Card, CardGrid } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';
import { LinkCard } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

## Descripcin General de Comandos

CPCReady proporciona un conjunto completo de comandos para gestionar imgenes de disco Amstrad CPC, archivos e integracin con emuladores. Todos los comandos son accesibles a travs del CLI `cpc`.

---

## Gestin de Discos

<CardGrid>
  <Card title="disc" icon="document">
    Gestionar imgenes de disco DSK
    
    - Crear nuevos discos vacos
    - Insertar discos en unidades
    - Mostrar informacin del disco
    
    [Ver Detalles ](../../reference/commands/disc/)
  </Card>
  
  <Card title="drive" icon="setting">
    Operaciones de unidad de disquete virtual
    
    - Montar discos en unidades A/B
    - Verificar estado de unidades
    - Expulsar discos
    
    [Ver Detalles ](../../reference/commands/drive/)
  </Card>
</CardGrid>

---

## Operaciones de Archivos

<CardGrid>
  <Card title="cat" icon="list-format">
    Listar todos los archivos en disco
    
    - Mostrar file catalog
    - Mostrar file sizes and types
    - Filter by user area
    
    [View Details ](../../reference/commands/cat/)
  </Card>
  
  <Card title="save" icon="add-document">
    Guardar files to DSK disk
    
    - Archivos binarios con cabeceras AMSDOS
    - BASIC programs
    - ASCII text files
    - Deteccin automtica de tipo
    
    [View Details ](../../reference/commands/save/)
  </Card>
  
  <Card title="filextr" icon="document">
    Extraer archivos del disco
    
    - Single or multiple files
    - Preserve AMSDOS headers
    - Extraer to current directory
    
    [View Details ](../../reference/commands/filextr/)
  </Card>
  
  <Card title="list" icon="open-book">
    Mostrar BASIC programs
    
    - Detokenize BASIC files
    - Sintaxis highlighting
    - Soporte for ASCII BASIC
    
    [View Details ](../../reference/commands/list/)
  </Card>
  
  <Card title="era" icon="trash">

## Referencia Rpida de Comandos

### Comandos de Disco y Unidad

| Comando | Descripcin | Ejemplo |
|---------|-------------|---------|  
| `cpc disc new <file>` | Crear DSK vaco | `cpc disc new blank.dsk` |
| `cpc disc insert <file> -A` | Insertar disco en unidad A | `cpc disc insert game.dsk -A` |
| `cpc disc info -A` | Mostrar informacin del disco | `cpc disc info -A` |
| `cpc drive A <file>` | Montar disco en unidad A | `cpc drive A system.dsk` |
| `cpc drive B <file>` | Montar disco en unidad B | `cpc drive B games.dsk` |
| `cpc drive status` | Mostrar estado de unidades | `cpc drive status` |
| `cpc drive eject -A` | Expulsar de unidad A | `cpc drive eject -A` |

### Comandos de Gestin de Archivos

| Comando | Descripcin | Ejemplo |
|---------|-------------|---------|  
| `cpc cat` | Listar archivos en disco | `cpc cat` |
| `cpc save <file> [type]` | Guardar archivo en disco | `cpc save loader.bin b 0x4000` |
| `cpc filextr <file>` | Extraer archivo del disco | `cpc filextr GAME.BAS` |
| `cpc list <file>` | Mostrar programa BASIC | `cpc list MENU.BAS` |
| `cpc era <file>` | Eliminar archivo | `cpc era OLDFILE.BIN` |
| `cpc ren <old> <new>` | Renombrar archivo | `cpc ren OLD.BAS NEW.BAS` |

### Comandos del Sistema

| Comando | Descripcin | Ejemplo |
|---------|-------------|---------|  
| `cpc model <464\|664\|6128>` | Configurar modelo CPC | `cpc model 6128` |
| `cpc mode <0\|1\|2>` | Configurar modo de vdeo | `cpc mode 1` |
| `cpc user <0-15>` | Configurar usuario CP/M | `cpc user 0` |
| `cpc settings` | Mostrar todas las configuraciones | `cpc settings` |
| `cpc configweb` | Lanzar configuracin GUI | `cpc configweb` |
| `cpc run [file]` | Lanzar emulador | `cpc run GAME.BAS` |---

import { Card, CardGrid } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; import { Icon } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; import { Aside } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; import { Badge } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; import { Tabs, TabItem } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; import { Code } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';
## Qu es CPCReady? **CPCReady** es una herramienta integral de lnea de comandos diseada para entusiastas del Amstrad CPC y desarrolladores de computacin retro. Proporciona herramientas modernas para gestionar imgenes de disco, archivos e integracin con emuladores desde tu entorno de desarrollo actual. Construido con **Python 3.13+** y potenciado por **Poetry**, CPCReady trae flujos de trabajo de desarrollo profesional a la computacin vintage.
Entusiastas de la computacin retro, desarrolladores de juegos, programadores BASIC y cualquiera que trabaje con imgenes de disco Amstrad CPC y emuladores.
--- ## Caractersticas Principales Crea, formatea y gestiona imgenes de disco **.DSK** con compatibilidad total CP/M. Soporte para 40 pistas, 9 sectores, formato estndar de 180KB. Simula unidades de disquete duales (A/B) con insercin, expulsin y monitoreo de estado instantneos. Como el hardware real. Guarda, extrae, renombra, elimina y lista archivos en imgenes de disco. Soporte completo para cabeceras AMSDOS y tipos de archivo (BASIC, Binario, ASCII). Lanza **RetroVirtualMachine** con configuracin automtica. Soporta paquetes .app de macOS, gestin de procesos y ejecucin de archivos. Soporte autntico de reas de usuario CP/M (0-15) para organizar archivos, como en sistemas CPC reales. Configura modelo CPC (464/664/6128), modo de vdeo (0/1/2) y ajustes del sistema. --- ## Inicio Rpido ### Comandos Esenciales ```bash # Estado de unidades cpc drive status # Listar archivos en disco actual cpc cat # Guardar archivo binario con direcciones cpc save loader.bin b 0x4000 0x4000 # Extraer archivo del disco cpc filextr GAME.BAS # Lanzar emulador con disco actual cpc run "loader.bas" ``` ### Consejoos de Archivo
  • b - Archivo binario (requiere direcciones de carga/ejecucin)
  • p - Archivo de programa (preserva cabecera AMSDOS)
  • a - Archivo ASCII/texto (sin cabecera)
  • auto - Deteccin automtica (por defecto)
 ### Archivo de Configuracin CPCReady almacena la configuracin en formato TOML: **Ubicacin**: `~/.config/cpcready/cpcready.toml` ```toml [drive] drive_a = "/path/to/system.dsk" drive_b = "/path/to/games.dsk" selected_drive = "A" [emulator] default = "RetroVirtualMachine" retro_virtual_machine_path = "/Applications/Retro Virtual Machine 2.app" [system] user = 0 # CP/M user area (0-15) model = "6128" # CPC model: 464, 664, or 6128 mode = 1 # Video mode: 0, 1, or 2 ``` ### Configuracin GUI Lanza la herramienta de configuracin grfica: ```bash cpc configweb ``` --- ## Categoras de Comandos **`disc`** - Crear, insertar e inspeccionar imgenes de disco - `disc new` - Crear DSK vaco - `disc insert` - Insertar DSK en unidad - `disc info` - Mostrar informacin del disco **`drive`** - Gestionar unidades de disquete virtuales - `drive A/B` - Montar disco - `drive status` - Mostrar estado de unidades - `drive eject` - Expulsar disco **Operaciones de archivos** en imgenes de disco - `cat` - Listar todos los archivos - `save` - Guardar archivo en disco - `filextr` - Extraer archivo - `era` - Eliminar archivo - `ren` - Renombrar archivo - `list` - Mostrar programa BASIC **Configuracin y ejecucin** - `run` - Lanzar emulador - `model` - Configurar modelo CPC - `mode` - Configurar modo de vdeo - `user` - Configurar rea de usuario CP/M --- ## Por qu CPCReady?
CPCReady cierra la brecha entre entornos de desarrollo modernos y sistemas clsicos Amstrad CPC. Ya sea que ests preservando software antiguo, creando nuevos juegos retro o explorando computacin vintage, CPCReady proporciona las herramientas profesionales que necesitas.
### Ventajas Clave - ** Rpido y Eficiente**: Interfaz de lnea de comandos para flujos de trabajo rpidos - ** Flexible**: Funciona con archivos DSK y emuladores existentes - ** Completo**: Todas las herramientas en un solo paquete - ** Preciso**: Manejo adecuado de cabeceras AMSDOS y compatibilidad CP/M - ** Multiplataforma**: Basado en Python, funciona en macOS, Linux y Windows - ** Modernooo**: Construido con Python 3.13+, type hints y mejores prcticas --- ## Ejemplo de Flujo de Trabajo Aqu hay un flujo de trabajo tpico de desarrollo con CPCReady: ```bash # 1. Crear un nuevo disco cpc disc new myproject.dsk # 2. Montarlo en la unidad A cpc drive insert myproject.dsk -A # 3. Guardar tu programa BASIC cpc save menu.bas a # 4. Guardar un cargador binario cpc save loader.bin b 0x4000 0x4000 # 5. Listar archivos para verificar cpc cat # 6. Lanzar en emulador cpc run MENU.BAS ``` --- ## Cdigo Abierto CPCReady es software de cdigo abierto licenciado bajo **Apache License 2.0**.
--- ## Listo para Empezar? Sigue nuestra gua completa de instalacin para configurar CPCReady en tu sistema. [Comenzar ](guides/install/) Explora todos los comandos disponibles con ejemplos detallados y opciones. [Ver Comandos ](guides/commands/) Ver historial de versiones y cambios. ## Mtodos de Instalacin

<Tabs>
  <TabItem label="Desde Cdigo Fuente (Recomendado)">

### Instalar desde Repositorio GitHub

<Steps>

1. **Clonar el repositorio**
   
   ```bash
   git clone https://github.com/CPCReady/cpc.git
   cd cpc
   ```

2. **Instalar con Poetry**
   
   ```bash
   poetry install
   ```

3. **Verificar instalacin**
   
   ```bash
   poetry run cpc --version
   ```

4. **Opcional: Aadir al PATH**
   
   Para un acceso ms fcil, puedes crear un alias en tu shell:
   
   ```bash
   # Para bash/zsh, aadir a ~/.bashrc o ~/.zshrc
   alias cpc='poetry run cpc'
   ```

</Steps>

<Aside type="tip">
Instalar desde cdigo fuente te da las ltimas caractersticas y te permite contribuir al desarrollo.
</Aside>

### Instalar desde ndice de Paquetes Python

<Aside type="caution">
El paquete PyPI an no est disponible. Usa el mtodo "Desde Cdigo Fuente" por ahora.
</Aside>

Cuando est disponible, podrs instalar con:

```bash
pip install cpcready
```

Verificar instalacin:

```bash
cpc --version
```

Actualizar a la ltima versin:

```bash
pip install --upgrade cpcready
```

## Configuracin Post-Instalacin

### 1. Configurar CPCReady

Ejecutar el asistente de configuracin:

```bash
poetry run cpc configweb
```

O editar manualmente el archivo de configuracin:

**Ubicacin**: `~/.config/cpcready/cpcready.toml`

```toml
[drive]
drive_a = ""
drive_b = ""
selected_drive = "A"

[emulator]
default = "RetroVirtualMachine"
retro_virtual_machine_path = "/Applications/Retro Virtual Machine 2.app"

[system]
user = 0
model = "6128"
mode = 1
```

### 2. Configurar Emulador (Opcional)

Si quieres usar el `cpc run` comando, configura la ruta de tu emulador:

<Steps>

1. Descargar **RetroVirtualMachine** desde [retrovirtualmachine.org](https://www.retrovirtualmachine.org/)

2. Instala el emulador en tu sistema

3. Configura la ruta en CPCReady:
   
   ```bash
   poetry run cpc configweb
   ```
   
   O editar `~/.config/cpcready/cpcready.toml` directamente:
   
   <Tabs>
     <TabItem label="macOS">
     ```toml
     [emulator]
     retro_virtual_machine_path = "/Applications/Retro Virtual Machine 2.app"
     ```
     </TabItem>
     
     <TabItem label="Linux">
     ```toml
     [emulator]
     retro_virtual_machine_path = "/usr/local/bin/RetroVirtualMachine"
     ```
     </TabItem>
     
     <TabItem label="Windows (WSL)">
     ```toml
     [emulator]
     retro_virtual_machine_path = "/mnt/c/Program Files/RetroVirtualMachine/rvm.exe"
     ```
     </TabItem>
   </Tabs>

</Steps>

## Verificar Instalacin

Prueba tu instalacin con estos comandos:

```bash
# Verificar versin
poetry run cpc --version

# Ver ayuda
poetry run cpc --help

# Crear un disco de prueba
poetry run cpc disc new test.dsk

# Montar el disco
poetry run cpc drive A test.dsk

# Listar archivos (debera estar vaco)
poetry run cpc cat
```

<Aside type="tip" title="xito!">
Si todos los comandos se ejecutan sin errores, CPCReady est correctamente instalado y listo para usar.
</Aside>

---

## Actualizar CPCReady

Para actualizar a la ltima versin:

```bash
cd /path/to/cpc
git pull origin main
poetry install
```

---

## Solucin de Problemas

### Poetry no encontrado

Si `poetry` no se encuentra, adelo a tu PATH:

```bash
export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"
```

Aade esta lnea a tu `~/.bashrc` o `~/.zshrc` para hacerlo permanente.

### Problemas con la versin de Python

Asegrate de tener Python 3.13 o superior:

```bash
python3 --version
```

Si es necesario, instala una versin ms reciente desde [python.org](https://www.python.org/downloads/).

### Errores de permisos

En Linux/macOS, puede que necesites ejecutar con los permisos apropiados:

```bash
sudo poetry install
```

### Problemas especficos de WSL

En Windows con WSL, asegrate de usar la versin Linux de Python, no la versin Windows.

import { Badge } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';
import { Card } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

<Card>Gestionar virtual floppy drives A and B: mount DSK files, check status, and eject disks.</Card>

## Uso

```bash
Uso: cpc drive [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

  Virtual drive management commands.

Comandos:
  A       Montar DSK file in drive A
  B       Montar DSK file in drive B
  status  Mostrar current disk status
  eject   Expulsar disco de unidad
```

---

<Tabs>
<TabItem label="drive A">

## drive A

Montar a DSK file in virtual drive A. Validates the file path and updates configuration for subsequent operations.

### Uso

```bash
Uso: cpc drive A [OPTIONS] DSK_FILE

  Montar DSK file in drive A.

Argumentos:
  DSK_FILE  Path to the DSK file to mount

Opciones:
  --help  Mostrar this message and exit.
```

### Ejemplos

#### Montar disk in current directory
```bash
cpc drive A system.dsk
```

#### Montar disk with absolute path
```bash
cpc drive A /Users/user/cpc/games.dsk
```

#### Montar disk with relative path
```bash
cpc drive A ../disks/backup.dsk
```

<Aside type="caution">
Si the DSK file doesn't exist, the command will display an error and won't modify the configuration.
</Aside>

<Aside type="tip">
Use `cpc drive status` to verify the disk is mounted correctly.
</Aside>

</TabItem>

<TabItem label="drive B">

## drive B

Montar a DSK file in virtual drive B. Validates the file path and updates configuration for subsequent operations.

### Uso

```bash
Uso: cpc drive B [OPTIONS] DSK_FILE

  Montar DSK file in drive B.

Argumentos:
  DSK_FILE  Path to the DSK file to mount

Opciones:
  --help  Mostrar this message and exit.
```

### Ejemplos

#### Montar disk in current directory
```bash
cpc drive B games.dsk
```

#### Montar disk with absolute path
```bash
cpc drive B /Users/user/cpc/utilities.dsk
```

#### Montar disk with relative path
```bash
cpc drive B ../../oldstuff/archive.dsk
```

<Aside type="caution">
Si the DSK file doesn't exist, the command will display an error and won't modify the configuration.
</Aside>

<Aside type="tip">
Use `cpc drive status` to verify the disk is mounted correctly.
</Aside>

</TabItem>

<TabItem label="drive status">

## drive status

Mostrar the current status of both floppy drives, showing which DSK files are mounted and their paths.

### Uso

```bash
Uso: cpc drive status [OPTIONS]

  Mostrar current disk status for drives A and B.

Opciones:
  --help  Mostrar this message and exit.
```

### Ejemplos

#### Mostrar drive status
```bash
cpc drive status
```

#### Alternative command
```bash
cpcdrivestatus
```

<Aside type="tip">
Shows which DSK files are currently mounted in drives A and B, along with their full paths.
</Aside>

<Aside type="note">
Drive configuration is stored in `~/.config/cpcready/cpcready.toml` under the `[drive]` section.
</Aside>

</TabItem>

<TabItem label="drive eject">

## drive eject

Expulsar (unmount) the currently inserted DSK disk from drive A o B, clearing the drive configuration.

### Uso

```bash
Uso: cpc drive eject [OPTIONS]

  Expulsar disco de unidad A o B.

Opciones:
  -A, --drive-a  Expulsar from drive A
  -B, --drive-b  Expulsar from drive B
  --help         Mostrar this message and exit.
```

### Ejemplos

#### Expulsar from drive A
```bash
cpc drive eject -A
```

#### Expulsar from drive B
```bash
cpc drive eject -B
```

#### Alternative command (drive A)
```bash
cpcdriveeject -A
```

#### Alternative command (drive B)
```bash
cpcdriveeject -B
```

<Aside type="tip">
Use `cpc drive status` after ejecting to verify the drive is empty.
</Aside>

<Aside type="note">
Ejecting removes the DSK path from `~/.config/cpcready/cpcready.toml` for the specified drive.
</Aside>

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

<Card>Eliminar (erase) a file from the currently mounted DSK disk. Soporta wildcards for batch deletion.</Card>

## Uso

```bash
Uso: cpc era [OPTIONS] PATTERN

  Eliminar file(s) from DSK disk.

Argumentos:
  PATTERN  File pattern to delete (soportes wildcards: *, ?)

Opciones:
  -A, --drive-a  Eliminar from drive A (default)
  -B, --drive-b  Eliminar from drive B
  --help         Mostrar this message and exit.
```

## Ejemplos

### Eliminar specific file
```bash
cpc era GAME.BAS
```

### Eliminar all .BAK files
```bash
cpc era *.BAK
```

### Eliminar from drive B
```bash
cpc era OLDFILE.BIN -B
```

### Eliminar all files starting with TEST
```bash
cpc era TEST*.*
```

### Alternative command
```bash
cpcera MYFILE.TXT
```

<video controls width="800" autoplay loop muted>
  <source src="/videos/cat.mp4" type="video/mp4" />
</video>

<Aside type="caution">
**Deletion is permanent!** Files are removed from the DSK without confirmation. Make backups before using wildcards.
</Aside>

<Aside type="tip">
Wildcards:  
**\*** matches any characters  
**?** matches single character  
Ejemplo: `DATA?.BIN` matches DATA1.BIN, DATA2.BIN, etc.
</Aside>
Comandos de gestin de imgenes de disco

import { Badge } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; import { Card } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; import { Code } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; import { Aside } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; import { Tabs, TabItem } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'; Gestionar DSK disk images: crear nuevos discos, insertar existentes, y mostrar informacin detallada sobre la estructura y contenido del disco. ## Uso ```bash Uso: cpc disc [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]... Comandos de gestin de imgenes de disco. Comandos: new Crear a new blank DSK disk image insert Insertar existing DSK into drive A o B info Mostrar detailed information about disk ``` --- ## disc new Crear a new blank DSK disk image file with standard CPC format (40 pistas, 9 sectores por pista, 512 bytes por sector). ### Uso ```bash Uso: cpc disc new [OPTIONS] DSK_FILE Crear a new blank DSK disk image. Argumentos: DSK_FILE Ruta al archivo DSK a crear Opciones: --help Mostrar this message and exit. ``` ### Ejemplos #### Crear blank disk in current directory ```bash cpc disc new mydisk.dsk ``` #### Crear disk with full path ```bash cpc disc new /path/to/newdisk.dsk ``` #### Alternative command ```bash cpcdisc new blank.dsk ```
Si the DSK file already exists, this command will **overwrite** it without confirmation.
Creates a standard CPC Data format disk: 40 tracks 9 sectors 512 bytes = 180KB capacity.
## disc insert Insertar an existing DSK file into virtual drive A o B. The command validates file existence and updates drive configuration. ### Uso ```bash Uso: cpc disc insert [OPTIONS] DSK_FILE Insertar existing DSK into drive A o B. Argumentos: DSK_FILE Path to the DSK file to insert Opciones: -A, --drive-a Insertar into drive A -B, --drive-b Insertar into drive B --help Mostrar this message and exit. ``` ### Ejemplos #### Insertararar disco en unidad A ```bash cpc disc insert game.dsk -A ``` #### Insertararar disco en unidad B with relative path ```bash cpc disc insert ../disks/system.dsk -B ``` #### Alternative command ```bash cpcdisc insert backup.dsk -A ```
You must specify either `-A` or `-B`. The command will fail if: - Neither drive option is specified - Both drive options are specified - The DSK file doesn't exist
Use `cpc drive status` after inserting to verify the disk is mounted correctly.
## disc info Mostrar detailed information about a disk image including structure, format, capacity, file types, and block usage. ### Uso ```bash Uso: cpc disc info [OPTIONS] [DSK_FILE] Mostrar detailed information about a disc file. Argumentos: DSK_FILE Path to DSK file (optional if using drive option) Opciones: -A, --drive-a Mostrar info for disc in drive A -B, --drive-b Mostrar info for disc in drive B --help Mostrar this message and exit. ``` ### Informacinrmacinrmation Displayed
  • Structure: Tracks, size, sides
  • Format: Disk type, sector information
  • Capacity: Total, used, free space
  • File Types: BASIC, Binary, ASCII counts
  • Blocks: Used blocks, first allocated block
### Ejemplos #### Mostrar info for disk in drive A ```bash cpc disc info -A ``` #### Mostrar info for specific DSK file ```bash cpc disc info mydisk.dsk ``` #### Mostrar info for disk in drive B ```bash cpc disc info -B ``` #### Alternative command ```bash cpcdisc info -A ```
Without options, the command uses the default drive (usually A).
--- ## Video Demo
All disk operations update the configuration file at `~/.config/cpcready/cpcready.toml`.

Mostrar BASIC file content from DSK

import { Badge } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';
import { Card } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';
import { Code } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';
import { Aside } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

<Card>Mostrar the contents of BASIC files stored on DSK disk images. Soporta tokenized and ASCII BASIC formats with syntax highlighting.</Card>

## Uso

```bash
Uso: cpc list [OPTIONS] FILE_NAME

  List BASIC file from virtual disc.

Argumentos:
  FILE_NAME  Name of BASIC file to display

Opciones:
  -A, --drive-a  Read from drive A (default)
  -B, --drive-b  Read from drive B
  --help         Mostrar this message and exit.
```

## Caractersticas

- **Tokenized BASIC**: Automatically detokenizes Locomotive BASIC files
- **ASCII BASIC**: Displays plain text BASIC files
- **Sintaxis Highlighting**: Rich console output with color coding
- **Format Detection**: Auto-detects BASIC format (tokenized vs ASCII)
- **Binary Detection**: Warns if file is binary (not BASIC)

## Ejemplos

### List BASIC file from drive A
```bash
cpc list GAME.BAS
```

### List BASIC file from drive B
```bash
cpc list MENU.BAS -B
```

### Alternative command
```bash
cpclist PROGRAM.BAS
```

### Mostrar tokenized BASIC
```bash
cpc list LOADER.BAS
```

<video controls width="800" autoplay loop muted>
  <source src="/videos/cat.mp4" type="video/mp4" />
</video>

<Aside type="tip">
The command automatically detects the BASIC format:
- **Tokenized**: Binary format with BASIC tokens (most CPC programs)
- **ASCII**: Plain text format created with editors or `SAVE "FILE",A`
</Aside>

<Aside type="caution">
Si you try to list a binary file (type 2), the command will display an error message:
```
Error: FILE.BIN is a BINARY file (type 2), not a BASIC program.
Use 'cpc filextr' to extract binary files.
```
</Aside>

<Aside type="note">
The command respects the current user number (see `cpc user`). Only files in the active user area will be accessible.
</Aside>

Guardar files to DSK disk with AMSDOS headers

import { Badge } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';
import { Card } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';
import { Code } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';
import { Aside } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

<Card>Guardar files to DSK disk images with automatic or manual AMSDOS header creation. Soporta binary, BASIC, and ASCII file types with hex or decimal addresses.</Card>

## Uso

```bash
Uso: cpc save [OPTIONS] FILE_NAME [TYPE] [LOAD_ADDR] [EXEC_ADDR]

  Guardar file to virtual disc with AMSDOS header.

Argumentos:
  FILE_NAME   File to save (required)
  TYPE        File type: 'b' (binary), 'p' (program), 'a' (ASCII), 'auto' (default)
  LOAD_ADDR   Cargar address in hex (0x5BCC, &5BCC) or decimal (23500)
  EXEC_ADDR   Execution address in hex or decimal

Opciones:
  -A, --drive-a  Guardar to drive A (default)
  -B, --drive-b  Guardar to drive B
  --help         Mostrar this message and exit.
```

## File Types

- **auto** (default): Detects type from content/extension
  - `.BIN` files  Binary with header
  - `.BAS` files  BASIC ASCII
  - Files with AMSDOS header  Preserves header
  - Other files  ASCII without header

- **b** (binary): Binary file with specific load/exec addresses
  - Requires LOAD_ADDR
  - EXEC_ADDR optional (defaults to LOAD_ADDR)
  - Adds AMSDOS header with type=2

- **p** (program): Program with AMSDOS header
  - Uses detected or specified addresses
  - Sets read-only attribute

- **a** (ASCII): Plain ASCII/data file
  - No AMSDOS header
  - Suitable for text files

## Address Formats

Addresses can be specified in three formats:

- **Hexadecimal with 0x**: `0x5BCC`
- **Hexadecimal with &**: `&5BCC`
- **Decimal**: `23500`

## Ejemplos

### Auto-detect file type
```bash
cpc save game.bin
```

### Guardar binary with hex addresses
```bash
cpc save 8bp.bin b 0x5BCC 0x4ABF
```

### Guardar binary with decimal addresses
```bash
cpc save screen.bin b 23500 19119
```

### Guardar binary with & notation
```bash
cpc save loader.bin b &4000 &4000
```

### Guardar BASIC ASCII file
```bash
cpc save program.bas a
```

### Guardar to drive B
```bash
cpc save data.bin b 0x8000 -B
```

### Alternative command
```bash
cpcsave myfile.bin b 0x4000
```

<video controls width="800" autoplay loop muted>
  <source src="/videos/cat.mp4" type="video/mp4" />
</video>

<Aside type="tip">
**Address conversion examples:**
- `0x5BCC` = `&5BCC` = `23500` (decimal)
- `0x4ABF` = `&4ABF` = `19119` (decimal)
- `0x4000` = `&4000` = `16384` (decimal)
</Aside>

<Aside type="caution">
Binary type 'b' requires at least the load address. Si execution address is omitted, it defaults to the load address.
</Aside>

<Aside type="note">
Files are saved to the current user number (see `cpc user`). The disk automatically updates its directory after saving.
</Aside>

## Uso

El comando se ejecuta utilizando el comando principal <Badge text="cpc" variant="note" />
pasndole como argumento el subcomando <Badge text="console" variant="tip" />

```bash
Uso: cpc console [OPTIONS]

  Interactive console with bottom status toolbar
```

## Caractersticas

### Barra de Estado Inferior

La consola muestra una barra de estado persistente en la parte inferior con:

- **Logo Amstrad**: Crculos de colores distintivos ()
- **Modelo CPC**: Muestra el modelo configurado (CPC 464, 664 o 6128)
- **Estado Drive A**: Nombre del disco montado o "Empty" si est vaco
- **Estado Drive B**: Nombre del disco montado o "Empty" si est vaco
- **Emulador**: Emulador configurado (RetroVirtualMachine, etc.)
- **Modo de Video**: Modo de pantalla actual (0, 1 o 2)

### Prompt Personalizado

El prompt muestra:
- Nombre de la aplicacin: <Badge text="CPCReady" variant="success" />
- Directorio actual de trabajo
- Indicador de entrada: <Badge text="~>" variant="tip" />

### Funcionalidades Interactivas

- **Historial de Comandos**: Navega comandos anteriores con  y 
- **Autocompletado**: Presiona Tab para autocompletar comandos y archivos
- **Persistencia de Estado**: Los drives y configuracin se mantienen durante toda la sesin
- **Acceso Completo**: Todos los comandos `cpc` estn disponibles directamente

## Comandos Disponibles

Dentro de la consola puedes ejecutar todos los comandos de CPCReady sin el prefijo `cpc`:

```bash
CPCReady ~/path ~> cat              # Listar archivos del disco
CPCReady ~/path ~> list test.bas    # Ver programa BASIC
CPCReady ~/path ~> save file.bin b 0x4000 0x4000  # Guardar binario
CPCReady ~/path ~> drive status     # Ver estado de drives
CPCReady ~/path ~> model 6128       # Cambiar modelo CPC
CPCReady ~/path ~> exit             # Salir de la consola
```

## Ejemplos

### Iniciar la Consola

```bash

```

```bash

CPCReady ~/path ~> save game.bas

# Listar programa BASIC
CPCReady ~/path ~> list game.bas

# Cambiar modelo
CPCReady ~/path ~> model 6128

# Ejecutar en emulador
CPCReady ~/path ~> run game.bas

# Salir
```

## Available Emulators

<Card title=" RetroVirtualMachine">
**RetroVirtualMachine** is a multi-platform emulator that provides accurate Amstrad CPC emulation.

- **Platform:** macOS, Windows, Linux
- **Caractersticas:** High accuracy, full peripherals soporte
- **Configuracin:** Use [`cpc rvm config`](/reference/commands/rvm/) to set path
- **Validation:** Requires specific version (v2.0 BETA-1 r7)
</Card>

<Card title=" M4Board">
**M4Board** is a physical hardware add-on for real Amstrad CPC computers.

- **Platform:** Real CPC hardware with M4 board
- **Caractersticas:** Direct hardware execution, SD card soporte
- **Configuracin:** Requires M4Board connected to your CPC
- **Speed:** Native CPC hardware speed
</Card>

## Configuracin Storage

The selected emulator is stored in your configuration file:

**Ubicacin:** `~/.config/cpcready/cpcready.toml`

**Format:**
```toml
[emulator]
selected = "RetroVirtualMachine"
```

Or:
```toml
[emulator]
selected = "M4Board"
```

## Caractersticas

<Card title=" Interactive Selection">
Uses Questionary for a clean, user-friendly menu interface with keyboard navigation.
</Card>

<Card title=" Current State Mostrar">
Shows the currently configured emulator before prompting for selection.
</Card>

<Card title=" Persistent Configuracin">
Saves your selection to the TOML configuration file for future sessions.
</Card>

<Card title=" Easy Switching">
Quickly switch between emulators without editing configuration files manually.
</Card>

## How It Works

1. **Mostrar current emulator** - Shows what's currently configured
2. **Present selection menu** - Interactive list with arrow key navigation
3. **Highlight default** - Current emulator is pre-selected
4. **Guardar choice** - Updates configuration file automatically
5. **Confirm change** - Shows success message with selected emulator

## Navigation

- **/ Arrow keys** - Navigate between options
- **Enter** - Confirm selection
- **ESC/Ctrl+C** - Cancel without changes

<Aside type="tip">
The selected emulator is used by the [`run`](/reference/commands/run/) command when launching software.
</Aside>

<Aside type="note">
After changing the emulator, make sure it's properly configured:
- For RetroVirtualMachine: Use `cpc rvm config` to set the path
- For M4Board: Ensure the board is connected and configured
</Aside>

Easily test your software on both emulator and real hardware without editing configuration files.

## Caractersticas

<Card title=" Connection Validation">
All commands automatically check M4Board connectivity before executing operations. Si the board is not reachable, operations are aborted with clear error messages.
</Card>

<Card title=" File Transfer">
Upload and download files between your computer and M4Board SD card over the network. Soporta custom destination directories and AMSDOS headers.
</Card>

<Card title=" Quick Execution">
The `run` command combines upload and execution in a single operation, uploading the file to `/tmp` and immediately executing it.
</Card>

<Card title=" Directory Management">
Full directory operations: create, navigate, list, and remove directories on the M4Board SD card.
</Card>

<Card title=" System Control">
Remote reset capabilities for both M4Board and CPC, plus pause functionality for debugging.
</Card>

<Card title=" Interactive Configuracin">
User-friendly IP configuration with automatic connection testing before saving settings.
</Card>

## Network Requirements

### M4Board Network Setup

1. **Connect M4Board to network** - Ethernet cable from M4Board to router/switch
2. **Assign static IP** - Configurar M4Board with a fixed IP address
3. **Note the IP** - You'll need this for CPCReady configuration

### Firewall Configuracin

Ensure your firewall allows:
- **HTTP (port 80)** - For M4Board web interface
- **Outbound connections** - From your computer to M4Board IP

## Common Workflows

### Development Workflow

Develop and test on real hardware:
```bash
# 1. Editar your program locally
# 2. Upload and run
cpc m4 run myprogram.bin

# 3. Si it crashes, reset and try again
cpc m4 reset-cpc
cpc m4 run myprogram.bin
```

### File Organization

Organize files on SD card:
```bash
# Crear project structure
cpc m4 mkdir /projects
cpc m4 mkdir /projects/game1

# Upload files
cpc m4 push sprite.bin -d /projects/game1
cpc m4 push music.bin -d /projects/game1
cpc m4 push main.bin -d /projects/game1

# List to verify
cpc m4 ls /projects/game1
```

### Backup and Restore

Download files from M4Board:
```bash
# Backup a save file
cpc m4 pull /saves/game.sav -o backup_game.sav

# Later, restore it
cpc m4 push backup_game.sav -d /saves
```

<Aside type="tip">
Use the `run` command during development for quick iterations. It automatically uploads to `/tmp` and executes, saving you from managing file locations.
</Aside>

<Aside type="note">
The M4Board must be powered on and connected to the same network as your computer. Check network connectivity with `cpc m4 status` before operations.
</Aside>

<Aside type="caution" title="Network Security">
The M4Board web interface is unencrypted HTTP. Only use on trusted local networks. Do not expose M4Board directamente to the internet.
</Aside>

## Solucin de Problemas

### Cannot Connect to M4Board

**Problem:** `M4Board is not reachable`

**Solutions:**
1. Verify M4Board is powered on
2. Check Ethernet cable connection
3. Ping the IP address: `ping 192.168.1.100`
4. Verify IP address is correct in config
5. Check firewall settings
6. Ensure M4Board and computer are on same network

### Upload Fails

**Problem:** File upload returns error

**Solutions:**
1. Check SD card is inserted in M4Board
2. Verify SD card has free space
3. Check file permissions (readable)
4. Ensure destination directory exists
5. Try creating directory first: `cpc m4 mkdir /games`

### Execution Does Nothing

**Problem:** `exec` command succeeds but program doesn't run

**Solutions:**
1. Verify file path is correct
2. Check file is executable format
3. Try with full path: `/games/program.bin`
4. Reset CPC and try again: `cpc m4 reset-cpc`

- [`emu`](/reference/commands/emu/) - Select between M4Board and emulator

## Detalles Tcnicos

### Communication Protocol

- **Protocol:** HTTP REST API
- **Port:** 80 (HTTP)
- **Timeout:** 2-30 seconds depending on operation
- **User-Agent:** `cpcready`

### File Upload

- **Endpoint:** `/upload.html`
- **Method:** POST multipart/form-data
- **Max File Size:** Limited by M4Board firmware

### Comandos

All commands use GET requests to `/config.cgi` with specific parameters:
- `?mres` - Reset M4
- `?cres` - Reset CPC
- `?run2=<file>` - Execute file
- `?mkdir=<path>` - Crear directory
- `?cd=<path>` - Change directory
- `?rm=<file>` - Eliminar file
- `?ls=<path>` - List directory
- `?chlt=CPC+Pause` - Pause CPC

## Required Version

<Aside type="caution" title="Version Requirement">
CPCReady requires **exactly** this version of RetroVirtualMachine:

## Caractersticas

<Card title=" Version Validation">
Automatically validates that the configured RetroVirtualMachine matches the exact required version by executing the emulator with `--help` flag and parsing the output.
</Card>

<Card title=" Safe Configuracin">
The `config` command only saves the path to configuration if validation passes. Invalid versions are rejected before being saved.
</Card>

<Card title=" Interactive Setup">
Uses Questionary for a user-friendly interactive prompt with path autocompletion and directory navigation.
</Card>

<Card title=" Path Resolution">
Automatically resolves relative paths to absolute paths and handles macOS `.app` bundles correctly.
</Card>

## Platform Soporte

### macOS
- **Format:** `.app` bundle (e.g., `/Applications/Retro Virtual Machine 2.app`)
- **Validation:** Locates the executable binary inside `Contents/MacOS/`
- **Execution:** Uses proper macOS application launching with `open -a`

### Windows
- **Format:** `.exe` executable
- **Validation:** Direct executable path validation
- **Execution:** Direct process spawning with DETACHED_PROCESS flag

### Linux
- **Format:** Binary executable
- **Validation:** Direct executable path validation
- **Execution:** Process spawning with new session

<Aside type="tip">
Always run `cpc rvm status` after installation or upgrade to ensure RetroVirtualMachine is properly configured.
</Aside>

<Aside type="note">
The configuration is stored in `~/.config/cpcready/cpcready.toml` under the `[emulator]` section.
</Aside>
